Creator: Microsoft (Marc McDonald) for NCR
Original operating system: Microsoft Standalone Disk BASIC-80 (later Microsoft Standalone Disk BASIC-86)

Creator: IBM
Original operating system: AIX{{efn |name=note-11 |IBM introduced JFS with the initial release of AIX Version 3.1 in 1990. This file system now called JFS1. The new JFS, on which the Linux port was based, was first shipped in OS/2 Warp Server for e-Business in 1999. The same sourcebase was also used for release JFS2 on AIX 5L.}}

Creator: Microsoft
Original operating system: Microsoft Windows, Linux, "classic" Mac OS, and FreeBSD

Creator: Microsoft
Original operating system: MS-DOS 7.10 / Windows 95 OSR2{{efn |name=note-10 |Microsoft first introduced FAT32 in MS-DOS 7.1 / Windows 95 OSR2 (OEM Service Release 2) and then later in Windows 98. NT-based Windows did not have any support for FAT32 up to Windows NT4
column5: Windows 2000 was the first NT-based Windows OS that received the ability to work with it.}}

Creator: Ecma International, ISO
Original operating system: Microsoft Windows, Linux, "classic" Mac OS, FreeBSD, and AmigaOS
